text:
Lubuntu is an [official Ubuntu flavor](https://ubuntu.com/download/flavours) that uses the [LXQt Desktop Environment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LXQt).  As is the case with all [official Ubuntu flavors](https://ubuntu.com/download/flavours), Lubuntu has access to all of the packages in Ubuntu's repositories and can use PPAs created for Ubuntu.

[Screenshots of Lubuntu](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Lubuntu_24.04)

## <div emoji="<:SeemsGood:478441196755091461>" style="display:none;"/> Advantages of Lubuntu
- Small install with around 1500 packages installed by default.
- Very easy on CPU and RAM.
- Can easily change the default Window Manager.

## <div emoji="<:glare:504911469943717909>" style="display:none;"/> Disadvantages of Lubuntu
- Least beginner friendly Ubuntu flavor.
- LXQt's customization options are not very polished and feel relatively unintuitive.
- LXQt tends to feel more like a collection of tools rather than an actual Desktop Environment.
- The team that packages Lubuntu sometimes creates buggy builds.

## <div emoji="<:think:585665071938666508>" style="display:none;"/> Should You Use Lubuntu?
Lubuntu is the least beginner friendly Ubuntu flavor, so those who are not computer savvy may have troubles adjusting the bland default settings.  Due to the disadvantages listed above, we do not recommend Lubuntu.  Instead, we recommend Kubuntu (see <div emoji="`{prefix}info kubuntu`" style="display:none;"/>[Kubuntu](#kubuntu)) as it has very similar resource use to Lubuntu and is much more friendly to use.

[Download Lubuntu](http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/lubuntu/releases/24.04/release/)

See <div emoji="`{prefix}info ubuntu`" style="display:none;"/>[Ubuntu](#ubuntu) for more information about Ubuntu.
